snippet: The latest rollback of the deadline, a six-month extension to July 1, 2014, underscores a struggle by the Treasury Department to enforce the new law, which was approved in 2010 amid heightened scrutiny of offshore private banking services sold to...
abstract: The latest rollback of the deadline, a six-month extension to July 1, 2014, underscores a struggle by the Treasury Department to enforce the new law, which was approved in 2010 amid heightened scrutiny of offshore private banking services sold to wealthy Americans. It was originally supposed to go into effect last January.

headline.main: Foreign Banks Win New Delay in Tax Evasion Rule
headline.print_headline: Treasury Dept. Delays Enforcing Tax Evasion Law
